description: The Transport for London Supplier Awards is our chance to recognise the excellent work our supply chain does for us, and recognising the contribution that a wide range of companies make to running and improving transport in our capital

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["The TfL Supplier Awards is our chance to recognise the excellent work our supply chain does for us, and the contribution that a wide range of companies make to running and improving transport in London."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
The 2019 TfL Supplier Awards ceremony will take place at the London Transport Museum on Wednesday 27 November.

The awards - open to all our suppliers - recoginise suppliers for efforts in various areas, such as working collaboratively with TfL to help make the transport network more innovative, delivering better value for money and improving transport in London. Suppliers will also be recognised for helping to address underrepresentation in the workplace, implementing innovation and protecting the environment.
TfL employees can also nominate suppliers.
We're inviting submissions in the following categories:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Health, Safety and Environment","Efficiencies and Innovation","Collaboration","Responsible Procurement","Small and Medium Enterprise"]}
First round submissions are now open - they close at 17:00 on Wednesday 4 September 2019.
Read the full list of categories and evaluation criteria:

In 2018 there were more than 100 submissions for the nine different awards. Taylor Woodrow BAM Nuttall was recognised as TfL's Supplier of the Year for its approach to collaborative working, enabling the company to work with us in an honest and proactive way, as well as for its high safety ethos and performance.

Taylor Woodrow BAM Nuttall was also commended for its involvement in upgrading Tottenham Court Road and Victoria Tube stations, making them more spacious, with step-free access, helping to ensure that the stations are accessible to all customers, including disabled or older customers, parents or carers with buggies and people with heavy luggage.
